sen.j: 陽泰院（ようたいいん、天文_(元号)10年（1541年） - 寛永6年1月8日 (旧暦)（1629年2月1日））は、肥前国佐賀藩祖鍋島直茂の正室。
sen.e: Yotaiin (1541 - February 1, 1629) was a legal wife of Naoshige NABESHIA, the founder of the Saga domain.
Yotaiin (1541 - February 1, 1629) was a legal wife of Naoshige NABESHIA, the founder of the Saga domain.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Yotaiin (1541 - February 1, 1629) was a legal wife of Naoshige NABESHIA, the founder of the Saga domain in Hizen Province.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 肥前国佐嘉郡与賀庄飯盛村（現在の佐賀県佐賀市本庄町鹿子）の城主石井常延の次女。
sen.e: She was the second daughter of Tsunenobu ISHII, the lord of Iimori-mura, Yoka no sho, Saga-gun, Hizen Province (Kanoko, Honjo-machi, Saga City, Saga Prefecture).
She was the second daughter of Tsunenobu ISHII, the lord of Iimori-mura, Yoka no sho, Saga-gun, Hizen Province (Kanoko, Honjo-machi, Saga City, Saga Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: She was the second daughter of Tsunenobu ISHII, the lord of Iimori-mura, Yoka no sho, Saga-gun, Hizen Province (present Kanoko, Honjo-machi, Saga City, Saga Prefecture).
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 母は九州千葉氏の庶家である黒尾氏の女蓮華院（日長尼）。
sen.e: Her mother was Rengein (Nicchoni), a dauter of Kuroo clan which was a branch family of Kyushu Chiba clan.
Her mother was Rengein (Nicchoni), a daughter of the Kuroo clan, which was a branch family of the Kyushu Chiba clan.
sen.cmt: spelling
sen.e: Her mother was Rengein (also known as Nicchoni), a daughter of the Kuro clan, which was a branch family of the Kyushu Chiba clan.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 名は彦鶴姫、また藤の方とも呼ばれた。
sen.e: Her name was Hikotsuruhime and she was also called Fuji no kata.
Her name was Hikotsuruhime, but she was also called Fuji no kata.
sen.cmt: punctuation
sen.e: Her name was Hikotsuruhime, but she was also called Fuji no kata.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 気丈夫で聡明、かつ慈悲深い性格が伝えられている。
sen.e: It has been pased down that she was a brave, clever as well as merciful woman.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: It has been passed down that she was a brave, clever and merciful woman.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: It is said that she was a brave, clever, and merciful woman.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 地元の佐賀県では賢夫人、国母と称されて、夫の直茂とともに現在でも人気のある人物である。
sen.e: In Saga Prefecture, her home, she is revered as a wise wife as well as the mother of nation and even at present, she is one of popular figures along with her husband Naoshige.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: In Saga Prefecture, her home, she is revered as a wise wife as well as the mother of the nation; even today she remains a popular historical figure along with her husband, Naoshige.
sen.cmt: grammar, punctuation
sen.e: In her home Saga Prefecture, she is revered as a wise wife as well as the mother of the nation; even today, she remains a popular historical figure along with her husband Naoshige.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: また、夫の直茂とは当時では珍しく今でいう恋愛結婚であった。
sen.e: To put it in modern-day language, she married Naoshige for love, which was rare at that time,
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: To put it in modern-day language, she married Naoshige for love, which was rare at the time.
sen.cmt: punctuation
sen.e: To put it in modern-day language, she married Naoshige for love, which was rare at the time.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 前田利家・芳春院、山内一豊・見性院 (山内一豊室) と並び安土桃山時代の代表的な夫婦として名高い。
sen.e: Along with the couple of Tosiie MAED and Hoshunin and the couple of Kazutoyo YAMANOUCHI and Kenshoin (the wife of Kazutoyo YAMANOUCHI), the couple of Naoshige and Rengein was one of the most well-known couples in the Azuchi-Momoyama period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Along with the couple of Tosiie MAED and Hoshunin and the couple of Kazutoyo YAMANOUCHI and Kenshoin (the wife of Kazutoyo YAMANOUCHI), the couple of Naoshige and Rengein was one of the most well-known couples in the Azuchi-Momoyama period.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Like the couple of Toshiie MAEDA and Hoshunin and the couple of Kazutoyo YAMANOUCHI and Kenshoin, the couple of Naoshige and Rengein was one of the most well-known couples in the Azuchi-Momoyama period.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 龍造寺隆信の重臣石井常延・黒尾氏夫妻の次女として、肥前国佐嘉郡与賀庄飯盛村に生まれる。
sen.e: She was born in Iimori-mura, Yoka no sho, Saga-gun, Hizen Province as the second daughter of the couple of Tsunenobu ISHII, a senior vassal of Takanobu RYUZOJI, and a daughter of Kuroo clan.
She was born in Iimori-mura, Yoka no sho, Saga-gun, Hizen Province as the second daughter of the couple of Tsunenobu ISHII, a senior vassal of Takanobu RYUZOJI, and a daughter of the Kuroo clan.
sen.cmt: article
sen.e: She was born in Iimori-mura, Yoka no sho, Saga-gun, Hizen Province as the second daughter of the couple of Tsunenobu ISHII (a senior vassal of Takanobu RYUZOJI) and a daughter of the Kuro clan.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 長兄は隆信の馬廻衆の勇将石井常忠、長姉は法性院（石井忠俊室）、弟は龍造寺政家の家老石井賢次、妹は日喜尼（鍋島氏家臣杉町信房室）。
sen.e: Her eldest brother was a brave general Tsunetada ISHII, Umamawarishu (bodyguard) of Takanobu, her eldest sister was Hoshoin (the wife of Tadatoshi ISHII), her younger brother was Katatsugu ISHII, Karo (chief retainer) of Masaie RYUZOJI, and her younger sister was Nikkini (the wife of Nobufusa SUGIMACHI, a vassal of NABESHIMA clan).

Her eldest brother was the brave general Tsunetada ISHII, Umamawarishu (bodyguard) of Takanobu, her eldest sister was Hoshoin (the wife of Tadatoshi ISHII), her younger brother was Katatsugu ISHII, the karo (chief retainer) of Masaie RYUZOJI, and her younger sister was Nikkini (the wife of Nobufusa SUGIMACHI, a vassal of the NABESHIMA clan).
sen.cmt: article
sen.e: Her eldest brother was the brave general Tsunetada ISHII, who was a bodyguard of Takanobu, her eldest sister was Hoshoin, who was the wife of Tadatoshi ISHII, her younger brother was Katatsugu ISHII, who was the chief retainer of Masaie RYUZOJI, and her younger sister was Nikkini, who was the wife of a vassal of the Nabeshima clan Nobufusa SUGIMACHI.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 陽泰院は長じて、龍造寺氏の家老納富信澄に嫁いだが、信澄が間もなく戦死したため、娘一人を連れて実家に戻っていた。
sen.e: Though Yotaiin married Nobusumi NOTOMI, a chief retainer of RYUZOJI clan, she returned to her parents' home together with her daughter since Nobusumi died in battle soon after marriage.
Though Yotaiin married Nobusumi NOTOMI, a chief retainer of the RYUZOJI clan, she returned to her parents' home with her daughter because Nobusumi had died in battle soon after marriage.
sen.cmt: article
sen.e: Though Yotaiin married Nobusumi NOTOMI, a chief retainer of the Ryuzoji clan, she returned to her parents' home with her daughter because Nobusumi had died in battle soon after the marriage.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: そんな矢先、龍造寺隆信・鍋島直茂らが、出陣の帰途、石井常延の屋敷に立ち寄り、昼食をとったことがあった。
sen.e: When she was at her parents' home, Takanobu RYUZOJI and Naoshige NABESHIMA called at the residence of Tsunenobu ISHII on the way back from a battlefield and had lunch.
When she was at her parents' home, Takanobu RYUZOJI and Naoshige NABESHIMA called at the residence of Tsunenobu ISHII on the way back from a battlefield and had lunch.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: When she was at her parents' home, Takanobu RYUZOJI and Naoshige NABESHIMA called at the residence of Tsunenobu ISHII on the way back from a battlefield and had lunch.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 突然の主君の来訪に、石井家では慌てて昼食の準備を始め、鰯を焼いてもてなすことにした。
sen.e: People of the ISHII clan dithered over the unexpected visit of the lord and started to broil sardines hastily for lunch.
People of the ISHII clan dithered over the unexpected visit of the lord and started to broil sardines hastily for lunch.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: People of the ISHII clan was embarrassed with the unexpected visit of the lord, started to broil sardines hastily for lunch.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: だが、人数が多くてなかなか鰯も焼きあがらない。
sen.e: However, it took time to broil sardines needed to serve many persons.
However, it took time to broil the sardines needed to serve many people.
sen.cmt: article
sen.e: However, it took time to broil all the sardines needed to serve a lot of people.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 陰からその様子をみていた陽泰院は炊事場に行き、「なんとも手際が悪い」と侍女たちを押しのけた。
sen.e: Yotaiin, who was watching the scene, went to the kitchen and pushed aside handmaids saying "You are too clumsy".
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Yotaiin, who was watching the scene, went to the kitchen and pushed aside the handmaids, saying, "You're too clumsy."
sen.cmt: punctuation
sen.e: Yotaiin, who was watching the scene, went to the kitchen and pushed aside the handmaids, saying, 'You're too clumsy.'
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションにしました。

sen.j: そして、みずから釜戸の火を庭先にばらまき、その中に大量の鰯を投げ込んだ。
sen.e: She then picked up by herself the burning firewood from the cooking stove, scattered it on the garden and threw many sardines into it.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: She then picked up the burning firewood from the stove, scattered it on the garden and threw numerous sardines into it.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: She then picked up the burning firewood from the stove, scattered it on the garden and threw numerous sardines into it.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: そして焼きあがった鰯を笊の上に乗せて、灰をふるい落とし、素早く隆信らの膳に供した。
sen.e: Thereafter, she put broiled sardines on a bamboo basket, shook off ashes and quickly served them to Takanobu and other people.
She then put the broiled sardines in a bamboo basket, shook off the ashes and quickly served them to Takanobu and others.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: She then put the broiled sardines in a bamboo basket, shook off the ashes and quickly served them to Takanobu and others.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 「葉隠」によれば、この一部始終を眺めていた直茂は、「あのような機転の利く女房を妻にしたい」と思い込んだ。
sen.e: According to "Hagakure" (The record of Nabeshima domain), Naoshige, who was watching everything, was consumed with a desire "to marry such a quick-witted woman".
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: According to "Hagakure" (the record of the Nabeshima domain), Naoshige, who was watching everything, was consumed with the desire "to marry such a quick-witted woman."
sen.cmt: punctuation
sen.e: According to "Hagakure" (the record of the Nabeshima domain), Naoshige, who was watching everything, was consumed with the desire 'to marry such a quick-witted woman.'
sen.cmt: 一部シングルクォーテーションにしました。

sen.j: その後、しばしば石井家を訪れては求婚し、二人は結ばれることになったと伝えている。
sen.e: Since then, according to "Hagakure", he visited ISHII' house frequently, asked her to marry and finally they married.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Subsequently, according to "Hagakure," he began visiting the ISHII house frequently, asked her to marry him, and finally she did.
sen.cmt: punctuation
sen.e: Thereafter, he began visiting the Ishii family frequently, asked her to marry him, and finally she did.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: その後、鍋島直茂の正室となり、龍造寺氏の軍師として活躍する夫を陰で支えた。
sen.e: Thus, she became the legal wife of Naoshige NABESHIMA and supported her husband, who was active as the strategist of RYUZOJI clan, behind the scene.
Thus she became the legal wife of Naoshige NABESHIMA and supported her husband, who was active as the strategist of the RYUZOJI clan, behind the scenes.
sen.cmt: punctuation
sen.e: Thus, she became the legal wife of Naoshige NABESHIMA and supported her husband, who was active as the strategist of the Ryuzoji clan behind the scenes.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 直茂の間には、長女千鶴（佐賀藩家老多久安順室）、次女彦菊（佐賀藩家老諫早直孝室）、長男鍋島勝茂（佐賀藩初代藩主）、次男鍋島忠茂（鹿島藩初代藩主）を儲けた。
sen.e: Between Naoshige, she had four children; the eldest daughter Chizuru (the wife of Yasutoshi TAKU, a chief retainer of the Saga domain), the second daughter Hikogiku (the wife of Naotaka ISAHAYA, a chief retainer of the Saga domain), the eldest son Katsushige NABESHIMA (the first lord of Saga domain) and the second son Tadashige NABESHIMA (the first lord of Kashima domain).

She had four children with Naoshige: the eldest daughter Chizuru (the wife of Yasutoshi TAKU, a chief retainer of the Saga domain), the second daughter Hikogiku (the wife of Naotaka ISAHAYA, a chief retainer of the Saga domain), the eldest son Katsushige NABESHIMA (the first lord of the Saga domain) and the second son Tadashige NABESHIMA (the first lord of the Kashima domain).

sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 「葉隠」によると、夫直茂との仲は終世よく、隠居した直茂とともに穏やかな老後の生活を送っている様子もみられる。
sen.e: According to "Hagakure", she had a happy married life with Naoshige throughout her life and after Naoshige retired, she spent her last days in peace and quiet together with him.
According to "Hagakure," she had a happy married life with Naoshige throughout her life, and after Naoshige retired she spent her last days in peace and quiet together with him.
sen.cmt: punctuation
sen.e: According to "Hagakure," she was happy with Naoshige throughout her life, and after Naoshige retired, she spent her last days in peace and quiet together with him.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: また、夫とともに家臣・領民を思いやる記述もみられる。
sen.e: In "Hagakure", there also exist a description that she, along with her husband, showed consideration for vassals and the people of the domain.
In "Hagakure," there is also description that she, along with her husband, showed consideration for vassals and the people of the domain.
sen.cmt: punctuation
sen.e: There is also a description that she, as well as her husband, showed consideration for vassals and the people of the domain.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 陽泰院は鍋島氏が名実ともに佐賀藩主となったことを見届けて、89歳の長寿を全うした。
sen.e: Yotaiin died at the old age of 89 after seeing the NABESHIMA clan became the lord of Saga domain both in name and reality.
Yotaiin died at 89 years of age, having seen the NABESHIMA clan become the lord of the Saga domain both in name and reality.
sen.cmt: article
sen.e: Yotaiin died at 89 years of age, satisfied herself that the Nabeshima clan become the lord of the Saga domain both in name and reality.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 夫直茂が死去し、落飾して10年後のことであった。
sen.e: That was 10 years after she entered into priesthood in the wake of her husband Naoshige's death.
That was ten years after she entered the priesthood, in the wake of her husband Naoshige's death.
sen.cmt: number
sen.e: That was ten years after her husband Nobushige died and she entered the priesthood.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 墓所は鍋島氏の菩提寺高伝寺に造営され、直茂の墓石に寄り添うように建てられた。
sen.e: Her grave was constructed, next to that of Naoshige, at Koden-ji Temple, the ancestral temple of the NABESHIMA clan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Her grave was constructed next to that of Naoshige, at Koden-ji Temple, the ancestral temple of the NABESHIMA clan.
sen.cmt: punctuation
sen.e: Her grave was constructed next to that of Naoshige at Koden-ji Temple, the ancestral temple of the Nabeshima clan.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 墓石はかつて夫直茂が朝鮮に出陣した折、陣中で一夜の枕とした石を持ち帰っていたものが用いられた。
sen.e: The stone which Naoshige once used as a pillow when he went into the battle in Korea and brought back to Japan was used for her gravestone.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: The stone that Naoshige had once used as a pillow when he went to do battle in Korea, and which he had brought back to Japan, was used as her gravestone.

sen.e: Her gravestone was the stone that Naoshige had used as a pillow for one night during the battle in Korea and brought back to Japan.
